body_html:
I have run into several issues in the CTC decoding.

  1. The greedy decoder seems to work right but has a problem with the documentation (still). Documentation online still shows
    A B B * B * B (where '*' is the blank label) becomes
    A B if merge_repeated=True.
    A B B B B B if merge_repeated=False.

Both results are wrong.
This should read:
A B B B if merge_repeated=True.
A B B B B if merge_repeated=False.

  1. I had a problem with the beamsearch decoder. Running the code of igormq above, but switching in the beamsearch decoder in place of the greedy decoder via:
    `merge = tf.sparse_tensor_to_dense(tf.nn.ctc_beam_search_decoder(abb_b_b, seq_len, merge_repeated=True)[0][0]).eval()

non_merge = tf.sparse_tensor_to_dense(tf.nn.ctc_beam_search_decoder(abb_b_b, seq_len, merge_repeated=False)[0][0]).eval()

print(merge)
print(non_merge)
`

the results for both are:
[[0 1 0 1]] or A B A B

which makes no sense.

Additionally, I have also had the problem where the beamsearch decoder did not properly deal with repeated characters and had to switch merge_repeated to False.

In summary, documentation problems in greedy decoder, code problems in beamsearch decoder.
